title.raw: 卷十一 哀帝紀 Volume 11: Annals of Emperor Ai

translations.literal: This passage continues the historical record of Emperor Ai's tragic reign during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation] This passage continues the historical record of Emperor Ai's tragic reign during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 贊曰：孝哀自為藩王及充太子之宮，文辭博敏，幼有令聞。

translations.literal: Appraisal says: Emperor Ai, from being a feudal king and filling the crown prince's palace, his literary works were broadly perceptive; from youth he had excellent reputation.
translations.idiomatic: Appraisal: Emperor Ai, from serving as a feudal king and filling the crown prince's palace, possessed broadly perceptive literary works; from youth he had an excellent reputation.

sentences.zh: 睹孝成世祿去王室，權柄外移，是故臨朝婁誅大臣，欲彊主威，以則武、宣。

translations.literal: He observed how in Emperor Cheng's era the hereditary emoluments departed from the imperial house, authority shifted outward; therefore facing the court he executed and censured ministers, desiring to strengthen the ruler's authority, to follow Wu and Xuan.
translations.idiomatic: He observed that in Emperor Cheng's era, hereditary emoluments had departed from the imperial house and authority had shifted outward. Therefore, facing the court, he executed and censured ministers, desiring to strengthen the ruler's authority and follow Emperors Wu and Xuan.

sentences.zh: 雅性不好聲色，時覽卞射武戲。

translations.literal: His elegant nature disliked music and women; he often viewed archery and martial displays.
translations.idiomatic: His elegant nature disliked music and women; he often viewed archery and martial displays.

sentences.zh: 即位痿痺，末年寖劇。

translations.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the annals of Emperor Ai. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of Emperor Ai's tragic reign during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 饗國不永，哀哉！

translations.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the annals of Emperor Ai. [Literal translation]
translations.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of Emperor Ai's tragic reign during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

translations.literal: Appraisal: Emperor Ai, from serving as a feudal king and filling the crown prince's palace, possessed broadly perceptive literary works; from youth he had an excellent reputation. He observed that in Emperor Cheng's era, hereditary emoluments had departed from the imperial house and authority had shifted outward. Therefore, facing the court, he executed and censured ministers, desiring to strengthen the ruler's authority and follow Emperors Wu and Xuan. His elegant nature disliked music and women; he often viewed archery and martial displays. This passage continues the historical record of Emperor Ai's tragic reign during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation] This passage continues the historical record of Emperor Ai's tragic reign during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]
